{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38131].
  {panel}

*Background of the request*

Currently in Confluence, Read notifications are automatically deleted after 2 weeks and Unread notifications are automatically deleted after 4 weeks. We cannot decide how long we want to show and delete the Workbox notification.

*Scenario*
User want to configure/change when the read notification should be deleted.
fields.summary: Option to manually configure workbox notification deletion

fields.description:
We are experiencing an issue when we type multiple labels (separated by commas) into the gallery macro field "Include Images with these labels only." The gallery performs an OR match and returns unwanted results.

The gallery macro documentation indicates that the  match is {color:#14892c}*AND, not OR*{color}

!Image Gallery.png|thumbnail!

This is the behavior we would prefer to see. 

Matching as an{color:red}* OR, not AND*{color} results in many unintended images displaying with our labeling system.

In the event that this is known or expected behavior by yourselves, could you please advise as to how we can get AND label matching in the image gallery macro?
fields.summary: Gallery Macro Bug

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38125].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a Confluence Administrator, I would like to configure the 'Attachment Download Security Policy' on a per space basis. At the moment, the setting is applied at a global basis, which does not work if you want attachments to be downloaded/displayed inline depending on the space.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to choose options (e.g. 'Insecure: Display all attachments inline.') for some spaces only while not affecting Confluence globally.
fields.summary: As a Confluence Administrator, I would like to configure the 'Attachment Download Security Policy' on a per space basis

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38123].
  {panel}

*+STEPS TO REPRODUCE+*
1. Launch Atlassian Documentation page from Search on JIRA ([Atlassian Doc Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/dosearchsite.action?queryString=JIRA&startIndex=0&where=AOD])
2. Type in "JIRA"

*+EXPECTED RESULT+*
Documentation site returns results related to the keyword "JIRA"

*+ACTUAL RESULT+*
Site returns message stating no results found
{noformat}
No results found for JIRA. Please try one of the following suggestions:
Use more general search terms or consult the online documentation for tips.
If you are filtering by space, content, last modification date or contributor, try removing or adjusting the filter
{noformat}
fields.summary: Search returns no results on Atlassian Documentation site

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38111].
  {panel}

h2.Summary
There is a bug in Confluence (on a Windows machine) when URL is pasted.

h2.Steps to Replicate
# Space Tools > Configure Sidebar.
# Click on *Add Link*; then click on *Web link* to add an external web URL to the side bar. 
# Copy any URL.
# Right Click and paste the URL into the text box and save it.

h2.Expected Result
Newly created link should be linking correctly.

h2.Current Result
Newly created link is linking back to the space.

h2.Note
The problem happens when:
* The URL is pasted using the right-click context menu (e.g. Right Click -> Paste).

The problem does *NOT* happen when:
* The URL is pasted using the keyboard shortcut 'Ctrl-V'.
*  The URL is typed in manually.
fields.summary: Copy Paste bug when adding URLs to the space sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38110].
  {panel}

We have JIRA Cloud account. It has English as a default language and everything looks and works OK.
Once we added Confluence Cloud to our account. After installation finished we found that Confluence uses German for most of interface elements and help. We checked settings and found that English was specified as default language. After we changed default language to German and back to English, some UI part migrated to English but rest stay in German.
Please look to attached pictures.
Today we installed Zephyr and get same situation as with Confluence - part of UI on English, part on German.
Can you help us to fix this issue?
fields.summary: Language mix on site

fields.description:
I had this page content in EAC and copied it to PUG. My @mentions are now links to the page itself. I of course saved without realising and wondered why no one who was mentioned had engaged with the page.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Start creating a page on a Confluence instance, insert an @mention in the page content, but do *not* save the page
2. Start creating a page on another Confluence instance - copy the contents from the editor in Step 1
3. At this point the user mention looks like it's been copied across successfully
4. Add a title and publish the page
5. Observe that after the page has been saved, the mention has been replaced by a link to the same page
fields.summary: Copying a mention from a draft in one instance to another will replace the mention with a link to the page itself
Ability to Import Word Documents generated from other Word Processing Software

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce
# Install Confluence (affects all versions)
# Install an expired license to put Confluence into "read only" mode
# Comment on a page

h5.Expected Results
# The user should not be able to add a comment

h5.Actual Results
# The comment is added successfully

h5.Why is this a problem?
Administrators relying on Confluence being read only during migrations might end up losing valuable comments - particularly if users have no other way to add information to a page.
fields.summary: With an expired license in place, Confluence allows users to post comments

1. Create a draft version of a page as an anonymous user.
2. Edit the page.
3. You will be prompter to view, resume or discard the draft.

This bug has existed since at least Conf 5.4. (probably earlier).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38103].
  {panel}

Whenever a user tries to edit the Space Permission and update its information, Confluence fails to do so and report the following error:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}
It happens if the space has given a permission to a group which has a white space in the group name (i.e test group).

*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a Space and create a group with a similar name.
For example:
#* Space: Space test
#* Group: Space test

# Try to update the Space Permission by adding the Space test group.
# Hit Save All.

*Expected behaviour*
# The permissions should be updated.

*Actual*
Nothing happens and all buttons are greyed out.
The following error appears on the console:
{code}
[Error] Error: Syntax error, unrecognized expression: [name=confluence_initial_viewspace_group_<instance_group>]
{code}

*Additional info*
Confirmed this will only affect Webkit based browsers, like Google Chrome and Safari.

*Workaround*
Use other browsers, like Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to save changes to Space Permissions for a group containing a whitespace
API Documentation For Page Properties Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38100].
  {panel}

From a quick search through the issues/bugs reported, it looks like many people are having issues with Markdown in Confluence. Not sure if this is different, but it's worth noting since we would love to see improvement here. 

When pasting Markdown in the converter in Confluence, the text doesn't convert properly. An anonymized version is attached for what we tried converting. The text prints out as one continuous line of text, with no formatting whatsoever. 

If there were someway to integrate the actual converter (http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/dingus) into Confluence, that would be great. Anything that improves this feature would be a step up and greatly appreciated. 

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Markdown to Confluence doesn't convert accurately

fields.description:
h3.Summary
If you add a task to a user on a page that have special characters (!@#$%)¨and then try to reach that page trough the tasks page, you will get a page not found error:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with the following title "Test!@#"
# Add a task to your user on this newly created page.
# Navigate to your task list page:
{code}
BASE_URL/plugins/inlinetasks/mytasks.action
{code}
# Now click into the hyperlink to the "Test!@#" under the *Task appears on* column.

h3.Expected Results
You should be redirected to the page.

h3.Actual Results
You get a page not found error:
!img.png|thumbnail!

h3.Work Around

Just remove the "?focusedTaskId=2" of the end of the URL and you will be redirected to the page without problems.
(i) The complete URL in my test would be BASE_URL/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=360457?focusedTaskId=2

h3.Environment
Windows Server 2008 R2
MS SQL Server 2014
fields.summary: Task lists redirection is not working when the target page have special characters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38096].
  {panel}

At least some users want to indent macro output: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/239977/answers/18812543?flashId=-307643035

Therefore, macros should not produce an automatic linebreak before the actual macro output, but they should use the indent of the "current cursor position", where the macro is positioned.

That way one could simply add spaces before the macro to get indentation.

Moreover, I've often wanted to have some macro output midst of a text or to the right of a text. Also that would then be possible.

h2. Alternative solution
An alternative or additional solution would be to produce macros "Inline" and "PositionHere". 

"PositionHere" macro would position its contents as if the top-left of the page would be the "current cursor position. (So people could place their Code Block or Page Tree into that macro, which could then be indented or to the right of some text.)

"Inline" macro would start the macro output at "current cursor position" but at the right end of the line (and at any linebreak) it would go on from the left. (Even if another macro such as Page Tree inside the Inline macro tries to produce its output as a separate paragraph.)

Thus, "Inline" means simply "Start macro output here as any other text" (or "indent just the first line, to this point", whereas "PositionHere" means "also indent every following line this much"). That would be great for, e.g., using include or Excerpt Include in the middle of a paragraph.

*If the panel macro would have an option for left margin* and/or left padding, that would be* exactly the "PositionHere" macro *(once you make border and background white), provided that there are also top and bottom margin options (I would set them 0). Then it would be just a box in the middle of the page without additional margins.
fields.summary: Macros like Code Block or Page Tree should not produce a linebreak

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the Blog Post Macro fails when using it in the Default Welcome Message template.  

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Confluence Admin
# Choose *Global Templates and Blueprints*
# Choose Edit next to *Default Welcome Message*
# Add the Blog Post Macro
# Save

h3. Expected Results

The blog post macro displays as normal.

h3. Actual Results

The Blog Post Macro does not render, and displays the following error:

{code:java}
$helper.renderConfluenceMacro("{blog-posts:space=@global|content=excerpts|max=5}")
{code}

There are no errors present in the logs.
fields.summary: Blog Post Macro fails when used in the Default Welcome Message template

fields.description:
I upgraded from 5.5.6 and can run Confluence off a command line so the upgrade works.  But my service won't start.

My Java 8 is in Program Files
I did have JAVA_HOME as C:\Program Files... (with the space)
That was when I installed the service
Now I have it as JAVA_HOME as C:\Progra~1... (without the space)
But my service won't start

The confluence export space to XML and Import space from XML toes NOT include any Look and Feel settings (Color theme) or Template Theme settings.

*Summary of The Bug*

When the Table of Contents macro is embedded within another User Macro, headings are only visible, the content beneath the headings disappear, and the page footer is rendered incorrectly and pushed to the right.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Create a User Macro with the following settings:
#* Macro Body Processing: Rendered
#* Template: {code}## @noparams

$body{code}
# Create a New Page and Edit
# Insert the User Macro and embed the Table of Contents macro with default settings
# Enter in some headings and text beneath the headings
# Save the Page

*Expected Results*

Headings are created into hyperlinks and below the headings and content should be rendered as typed.

*Actual Results*

Heading hyperlinks are only created and non-hyperlinked headings aren't visible along with the content. Page footer is also rendered incorrectly and skewed to the right of the page.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38073].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently is only possible to create JIRA Issues from Confluence if JIRA has only these fields as required:
* System fields:
** Component
** Fix Versions
** Affect Versions
** Priority
** Due date
** Environment
** Assignee
** Reporter
** Labels
* Custom fields which have these field types such textfield, textarea, URL, number

Some customers need different field types to be required, which prevents this functionality from working.

h3. Suggested Solution
As a Confluence and JIRA user, I would like to be able to add different custom fields (' types) as required. Ideally, I'd like to be able to add any custom field I have in my JIRA instance as required, and this field be recognised in Confluence during the issue creation.
fields.summary: Ability to create issues with required custom fields that aren't default field types

Another way to phrase this would be allowing end users who don't have permission to edit a page configure the results of the macro. 

Another use case would be the curator of a page providing a JIRA Issues Macro that could be used to track the results across a few different projects, allowing the user to select one.

It is known that anybody who is in the confluence-administrator group can access any restricted spaces. Since we have an [improvement request|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-4616] to remove the confluence-administrator's privileges(_to access any space_),  a customer [suggested in a ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-150378] to restrict spaces using passwords, in that way, confluence administrators won't be able to access sensitive content as we have some tickets and [Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/4162/restrict-viewing-for-confluence-administrators] regarding this kind of issue.

h2. Improvement
Would like the option to display, above or below the macro, a list of all the labels used for all the attachments. 

For example, (Using numbers to indicate labels and letters to indicate attachments) if I had 3 attachments with the following labels:
AAA: 124
BBB: 321
CCC: 678, 124
I want a list at the top of the macro that says "124, 321, 678". 

It would be ideal if you could click on any given label to filter the attachments to only show attachments that have that label. So, to continue the example, if I clicked on 124 on the top, just AAA and CCC would be shown.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38037].
  {panel}

As a space administrator, I want to be able to limit WHO (user or group) can use a specific template so that I can restrict certain content types to specific users or groups.

Use case:
We use Confluence for our corporate intranet. In general, we want the intranet to be open and editable by all in order to increase collaboration and knowledge sharing (space editing permission for all). However, on the landing page, we pull in news and newsletters (content by label macro), which we target to different groups (show if macro).

I have created templates for news (corporate-wide, EMEA news, Denmark news, etc), which ensure the right labels are on each news item so that it is presented to the right audience.

So far, so good.

However I really want to limit who can use those templates. Only specific people can create company-wide news, only people in Denmark can create DK news, etc. Right now I hide Create from Template buttons in the show if macro, but anyone who clicks *Create* can see all the templates and create whatever they want.

My HR overlords would be so pleased if we could actually restrict access to the templates

:-)
fields.summary: Ability to restrict who can use a template

fields.description:
I have uploaded an attachment which has hyphen("-") in its name, to a confluence page. 
When I try to search the attachment by clicking "insert -> images -> Search -> This space", 
attachment was not found in Search result. 
Confluence Search is not able to find the attachment if it has "-" in the name.

+Steps to reproduce:+
* Upload an attachment which has "-" in it's name to a confluence page.(Ex: Outlook-encrypt.png)
* Edit the page and try to embed the attached image on this page by clicking "images => Search => This space".
* Enter the search string as "Outlook-encrypt" and search.
* Even though attachment exists, it will not be displayed while searching with search string "Outlook-encrypt".

It's very common practise to have hyphen in file names. 
There are many attachments uploaded to our Confluence pages by users have the hyphens in attachment names.
Our users are not able to search the attachments because of this issue.
fields.summary: Confluence Attachment search does not work if the attachment name has hyphen  "-"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38035].
{panel}
On IE10 or IE11, "Edit in Office" opens the file in Office correctly the first time you click on the option. Then you save or close the Office document and back on Confluence, clicking again on "Edit in Office" nothing happens.

In order to use the functionality again the IE window has to be closed and reopened.

*Environment:*
 - Windows 7
 - MS Office 2010 (no compatibility pack is installed)
 - Java, via *Programs and Features* versions are :
 -- Java 7 Update 71 (64bit) v7.0.710
 -- Java SE Development Kit 7 Update 71 (64bit) v1.7.0.710
 -- Java 6 Update 21 v6.0.210
 -- Java 6 Update 39 (64bit) v6.0.390
 - Browsers
 -- IE11
 -- IE10

*Steps to Reproduce:*
 # Add Word 2010 document to a page. (a one sentence document would do)
 # Click on "Edit in Office" and after entering your Confluence credentials the file will be opened in Office Word 2010
 # Save then Close the document in Word.
 # Click on "Edit in Office".

*Expected Result:* The document is once again opened in Office Word 2010
 *Actual Result:* Nothing happens. No errors displayed on screen.

Confluence logs an error: (full confluence-log.txt attached)
{noformat}
 2015-06-19 11:38:01,787 ERROR [TP-Processor36] [extra.webdav.servlet.ConfluenceWebdavServlet] service Unexpected error
  -- url: /wiki/plugins/servlet/confluence/editinword/13139974/attachments/SimpleWordDocument.docx | userName: user-name
 org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.DavException: Precondition Failed
 	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.lock.SerializableLockManager.releaseLock(SerializableLockManager.java:185)
 	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractConfluenceResource.unlock(AbstractConfluenceResource.java:416)
 	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.server.AbstractWebdavServlet.doUnlock(AbstractWebdavServlet.java:709)
{noformat}
but the problem is when clicking the option a second time. The first time it opens correctly which proves that the [Office Connector Prerequisites|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ConfCloud/Office+Connector+Prerequisites] are met.

IE Private Mode exhibits the exact same behaviour.

*Workaround:*
Close Internet Explorer and reopen it again to use the "Edit in Office" functionality again.
fields.summary: "Edit in Office" fails to open file on the second attempt on IE10 and IE11

  {panel}

h4. Problem
Confluence added support for Oracle 12c in Confluence 5.7, but the selector for external database types still states Oracle 11g as the only option. This can be extremely confusing for someone installing Confluence when using Oracle 12c. 

h4. Solution
Change the selector to just state Oracle (since multiple types are supported).
fields.summary: Change external database selector to Oracle instead of Oracle 11g

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38025].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
For long running Space Exports using Content Tool Export, would like the ability to navigate off the Export Progress Page and still be able to gather the file(s) when the Export completes.
Currently if you navigate away from the Export Progress page (either clicking on another link or due to session timeout), there is not a way to collect the Exported File or be notified if it completed.

h3. Suggested Solution
An option to perform an Export in the background and then present a notification or path to the file's storage location where it can be collected
 
h3. Workaround 
The Export Progress Page needs to remain open in a Tab or Window so that the file can be collected when complete.
fields.summary: Background Export of Pages and Collect Export from Alternative Location

fields.description:
h2. Step to reproduce:
# Set up a 2 node CDC cluster (change Hazelcast port on second node if setting both nodes on same machine)
# Configure a load balancer in front. I used Apache HTTP Server with mod_proxy_balancer module. My configuration (I had "mydomain.com" set to point to my own machine via the hosts file):
{code}
<VirtualHost *:80>
ProxyRequests off
 
ServerName mydomain.com
 
<Proxy balancer://mycluster>
BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:8888 route=node1
BalancerMember http://127.0.0.1:9999 route=node2
 
Order Deny,Allow
Deny from none
Allow from all
 
ProxySet lbmethod=byrequests
ProxySet stickysession=JSESSIONID

</Proxy>

ProxyPass / balancer://mycluster/
ProxyPreserveHost on
</VirtualHost>
{code}
# Edit setenv.sh and add -DjvmRoute=node1 and -DjvmRoute=node2 to start up parameters on each node, respectively
# Edit server.xml and add proxyPort, proxyName, and scheme so that they point to the front-end (in my case, http://mydomain.com:80).
# In Confluence Admin > Office Connector, enable checkbox to allow ocauth tokens to be passed in the URL
# Upload a Word document
# Attempt to use Edit in Office

h2. Expected behavior
Word opens the document and displays the document contents as expected. Changes are saved back to Confluence via WebDAV

h2. Actual behavior
Word launches, but no document content is loaded as Word is unable to download the document from Confluence WebDAV
(!) May need to try several times to get this to fail, as the problem only occurs when the Attachment page is accessed via one node, but yet the Edit in Office tries to open the document via another node

h2. Root cause
In the failed case, WebDAV can not get authentication to open the Word document
fields.summary: Edit in Office opens MS Word document with empty content on Data Center (clustered) enviroment

This has been tested with Chrome, Safari, Firefox, and IE9.

Please let me know if we need any other details to address this. 

Thank you!

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attached excel chart will not automatically re-sized to fit in Confluence page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page
# Attach [^Chart.xlsx]
# Edit the page using [Source Editor macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor], and add the page with the storage format [^Source.txt]
NB: This storage format creates a page with a 2 column page layout. The chart is in the left, and there is text in the right. The chart is displayed over the top of the text.

h3. Expected Results
The displayed chart that is utilizing the view file macro, should be re-sized automatically to better fit the Confluence page 

h3. Actual Results
The displayed chart is not re-sized and displayed as its actual size. This results in overlapping other components in the page. See the screenshot:
!Chart.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workarounds
# Edit the chart size manually from the source document
# Use the [new File Previewer|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Displaying+Files+and+Images#DisplayingFilesandImages-PreviewingimagesandPDFs]
fields.summary: Excel chart size are not automatically re-sized when attached to a Confluence page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-38011].
  {panel}

(Using Jira agile)

Currently, the flow of updating basic fields in any issue type takes far too long (7 clicks to change assignee). This adds up a lot when you consider how often users are doing this and is one of the biggest drawbacks compared to competing agile software options.

All fields in any issue should have the auto-edit ability on mouse highlight like the estimate and remaining fields, for example. Users should not have to bring up a separate window.

This will speed up users by exactly a million percent.
fields.summary: Reduce friction on updating high frequency fields (assignee, labels, etc.)
